com.smartsockets
Interface TipcConnServer

public interface TipcConnServer

Handles the server end of a peer-to-peer connection. This class only allows a "listening post" to be created for accepting new connections. All actual communication is done using the TipcConnClient class returned by the accept method.

See Also:
TipcConnClient

Method Summary
 TipcConnClient accept()
          Listens for a connection to be made and accepts it.
 void destroy()
          Destroys the server connection "listening post".
 

Method Detail

destroy

public void destroy()
             throws TipcException
Destroys the server connection "listening post".

Throws:
TipcIOException - for socket errors.
TipcException - for all other errors.

accept

public TipcConnClient accept()
                      throws TipcException
Listens for a connection to be made and accepts it.

Returns:
a TipcConnClient object representing the new client connection
Throws:
TipcIOException - for socket errors.
TipcException - for all other errors.
See Also:
TipcConnClient
